sentences.sContent: The eagle hovered, ready to swoop at any moment.
sentences.sCn: 鹰在天空盘旋，随时准备俯冲下来。

synos.tran: 猛扑；突然袭击；突然下降；飞扑

trans.tranOther: if the police, army etc swoop on a place, they go there without any warning in order to look for someone or something
a sudden surprise attack on a place in order to get something or take people away – used especially in news reports
